summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys discussing a new potential victim of Leon Black. The victim alleges she was violently sexually assaulted by Black in the early 2000s at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse, where she worked giving massages. The attorneys are coordinating to have the victim speak to law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney who received a call from a potential victim alleging rape by Leon Black. She is communicating with another attorney about the allegations and coordinating a potential interview.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Billionaire financier accused of violently sexually assaulting a woman at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse in the early 2000s. The victim alleges he bit her during the assault.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender. His New York townhouse is the alleged location where the victim met Leon Black and where the assault occurred. He introduced the victim to Black.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate, mentioned as someone the victim met a number of times at Epstein's townhouse.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: Judge presiding over Maxwell civil cases (Case number 15 Cv. 7433), where phone messages for Leon Black were unsealed.

connections.description: Black was introduced to the victim by Epstein at Epstein's townhouse. Epstein presented Black as someone who could help the victim get a job.
The victim alleges Black violently sexually assaulted her, including biting her, during a massage at Epstein's townhouse. He later contacted her to meet and gave her cash.
The victim worked giving massages at Epstein's townhouse for a few months. Epstein knew she needed money and discussed helping her with her financial problems.
Christensen received a call from the victim detailing the assault and is representing her interests, including coordinating a talk with law enforcement.
Maxwell is mentioned as someone the victim met multiple times at Epstein's townhouse, indicating her presence and association with the location.

events.title: Alleged Assault by Leon Black
events.description: A woman alleges she was violently sexually assaulted by Leon Black, including being bitten, during a massage at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse.

events.title: Flight to Florida with Black
events.description: Mention of a flight to Florida with Leon Black in September 2008, referenced from unsealed phone messages in Ghislaine Maxwell's civil case.

events.title: Attorney Call Regarding Allegations
events.description: Attorney Jeanne Christensen discusses details of a new victim's allegations against Leon Black with another attorney, including the victim's background and willingness to speak to law enforcement.

events.title: Victim Meets Epstein and Black
events.description: The victim met Jeffrey Epstein at his townhouse office and was later introduced to Leon Black there by Epstein.

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10003 (Wigdor LLP office)
Florida (mentioned in context of a flight)
keyFacts: A new, previously unknown victim has come forward alleging Leon Black violently sexually assaulted her at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse in the early 2000s.
The assault is described with specific, abnormal details, including violent biting of the victim's vulva, labia, and clitoris, which match allegations from another of Christensen's clients.
The victim worked giving massages at Epstein's townhouse and met both Epstein and Black there; Epstein introduced Black as someone who could help her get a job.
After the assault, Black contacted the victim, met her at the St. Regis hotel, discussed her debt, and gave her an envelope of cash.
The victim is willing to speak to law enforcement but is concerned about her job, and attorneys are coordinating this communication.
